Tommy_Shane_Steiner:
{{short description|American singer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Tommy Shane Steiner | background = solo_singer | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|10|9}} | origin = [[Austin, Texas]], United States | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer | years_active = 2001–2002 | label = [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] | associated_acts = [[Bridgette Wilson]] }} '''Tommy Shane Steiner''' (born October 9, 1973) is an American [[country music]] artist. He made his debut in 2001 with the single "[[What If She's an Angel]]", which reached a peak of No. 2 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] charts. It was the first of three chart singles from his singular album ''[[Then Came the Night]]'', which was released in 2002 on [[RCA Records Nashville]]. ==Biography== Steiner was born in [[Austin, Texas]] to parents who were both [[rodeo]] entertainers.[{{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p529048/biography|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( Tommy Shane Steiner > Biography )))] His main goal, however, was to become a country music artist. He began touring throughout the state of [[Texas]], playing various clubs throughout the state. [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] signed Steiner in 2001, and his debut single, "[[What If She's an Angel]]", was released that year, followed by the album ''[[Then Came the Night]]''. The single was added to the playlists of nearly 100 of the stations on ''Billboard'''s panel in one week.[http://countrymusic.about.com/library/bltssbio.htm Tommy Shane Steiner bio] "What If She's an Angel" peaked at No. 2 on the ''Billboard'' U.S. [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] charts. Follow-up singles were less successful, however, and Steiner parted ways with RCA Nashville in December 2002.[https://web.archive.org/web/20070930040953/http://www.cmt.com/artists/news/1459112/20021211/tommy_shane_steiner.jhtml CMT.com : Tommy Shane Steiner : Tommy Shane Steiner Exits RCA] He has not recorded since. Post RCA After Steiner left RCA, he returned to the family cattle ranch in Austin. He sold the ranch to a developer and currently owns the Steiner Ranch Steakhouse. Though he occasionally performs in the restaurant, Steiner has no intention of returning to the music business. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:15em;"| Details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
